snippet: The issue has emerged as a priority on the housing agenda of Mayor Bill de Blasio, who has begun a subsidy program to move hundreds of abuse victims out of shelters.
abstract: Domestic violence has emerged as a priority on housing agenda of New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, who has begun rent subsidy program to move hundreds of abuse victims out of homeless shelters; program has also stepped up counseling efforts in public housing; addressing issue is challenging, since financial aid to evade eviction does not work when a woman and her children have to escape their home.
lead_paragraph: The issue has emerged as a priority on the housing agenda of Mayor Bill de Blasio, who has begun a subsidy program to move hundreds of abuse victims out of shelters.

headline.main: Domestic Violence Drives Up New York Shelter Population as Housing Options Are Scarce
headline.print_headline: Homeless, Because They Are Abused at Home
